assignments.name: 4.2 ASSIGNMENT: Take a Walk to Find an Ecosystem (Due September 19)
assignments.intro:
Take a Walk to Find an Ecosystem (20 points)

Learning Objective: I can identify patterns evident in the geographic distribution of ecosystems and biomes and explain how humans interact with them. (WG Standard 1.2)

Before completing this assignment, please review the following resources:

  • What Is An Ecosystem?
  • Threats to Our Environment
  • Producers, Consumers, and Decomposers
For this assignment, I would like you to take a walk. I know, this isn't PE, but I would like you to go on a walk. Visit land that is close to where you live (i.e., mountains, lakes, a park, or undeveloped land). You need to discover an ecosystem. Look around you and find an ecosystem, taking notes of its elements and how they work together. You will go home and draw your ecosystem. (You can use an online illustrator or another online drawing tool.) If you aren't an artist, pictures are also welcome.

As with all assignments, this must be your own work. Plagiarism is forbidden. Please review the plagiarism policy in the "About This Course" section of the class.

To turn in this assignment:

  1. Click here to open the Worksheet. The worksheet will open in Google Docs.
  2. Choose File then Make a Copy. This will give you a copy that you can type in.
  3. Complete the assignment and save the document in Google Docs as LASTNAME Assignment Name.
  4. When you are finished click Share in the right-hand corner
  5. Change the sharing setting to Anyone at Mountain Heights Academy can edit. This will allow your teacher to edit and comment on your assignment.
  6. Click Copy Link
  7. To submit your assignment, return to this page and click Add Submission
  8. Paste the link to your Google Doc into the Online Text box (ctrl+v)
  9. Click Save Changes

assignments.name: 5.5 ASSIGNMENT: Teacher Check-In (Due September 26)
assignments.intro:
Teacher Check-In (15 points)

Learning Objective:  Students will meet one-on-one with their teacher to discuss their progress and needs to support their success in the course. (ELA Standard 9-10. SL1)


This quarter, I want to meet with each student to get acquainted, improve your writing, and discuss your goals. This will be a low-pressure opportunity for us to talk one-on-one in a video call with our cameras and mics on. This meeting will only last 10-15 minutes (unless you want to spend a full 30 minutes working on something together). You do not need to prepare anything for this meeting.

This meeting will be worth 15 points to your grade.

On the day and time of your meeting, you can find the meeting link on your calendar, or I will send you a Google Chat with the link. 

If needed, please click on this link for a Calendly Tutorial.

Not showing up for your appointment without contacting your teacher in advance to reschedule may result in a deduction of points. 

Instructions to sign up:

  1. View your teacher's availability here.
  2. Choose a date and time that works for you, then click Confirm.
  3. Type your name, school email address, and phone number. Then click Schedule Event.
  4. Your appointment is now automatically added to your Google Calendar. You will also receive an email confirmation.

After your appointment:

  1. After we meet, click Add Submission
  2. In the Online Text box type "I met with my teacher this week."
  3. Click Save Changes

assignments.name: 10.1 ASSIGNMENT: Cultural Diffusion Research (Due October 31)
assignments.intro:
Cultural Diffusion Research (20 points)

Learning Objective: I can identify identify the causes, methods, and effects for the diffusion and distribution of cultural characteristics and cite examples of how globalization creates challenges and opportunities for different cultures. (WG Standard 3.4, 3.6)

Before completing this assignment, study the following resources:

  • Cultural Diffusion
  • Types of Cultural Diffusion

For this assignment, you will be researching Cultural Diffusion and demonstrating how it works through a project! I want you to research an example of cultural diffusion, either from history or from the world today. Here is a list of suggested topics:

Types of cultural diffusion:

  • Music (Rap, Jazz, etc.)
  • Fashion (Skinny jeans, baseball caps, shoulder pads, etc.)
  • Food (The Columbian exchange, cultural foods, fast food)
  • Technology (writing, electricity, etc.)
  • Art (memes, painting styles, etc.)
  • Language (slang, spreading of language)

You have three options for your project. You only need to do ONE of the three options.

OPTION 1: Create a creative story, depicting an example of cultural diffusion.

OPTION 2: Create a Google Slide Presentation teaching about an example of cultural diffusion. You may use this TEMPLATE.

OPTION 3: Create a cartoon strip teaching about an example of cultural diffusion.

Here is the rubric you will be graded on:

To turn in this assignment:

  1. Return to this page and click Add Submission
  2. Paste the link to your project into the Online Text box
  3. Click Save Changes
